intro: Scrophularia verna, commonly known as spring scrophularia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Scrophularia verna is part of the plantain family (Plantaginaceae) and is known for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
